item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 26th September
item.description:
Customer states that a nearby developer has recently installed trees and large rocks on this verge, which has completed removed the visibility splays for vehicles leaving the Archery Club onto the main road. Asking if these are allowed to be here and if they can be removed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch ready to fall onto road, 26th September
item.description:
There is a damaged tree branch which will fall onto the road soon. This has the potential to cause a serious car incident. Why donâ€™t you just cut this branch and remove it before it does? Especially now there is a temporary traffic light near by.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have asked Cheltenham Borough Council several times for an annual street clean & been told this is delayed due to availability of GCC contractors & lack of resources, response., 26th September
item.description:
Large amounts of rubbish & debris in the road & pavements both sides of the road. Blocked & heavily littered curbs, covering & blocked drains. Trees significantly overgrown & need pollarding. This throughout Alstone Avenue & previous twice yearly street clean has stopped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Alstone Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Elmbridge court roundabout, 25th September
item.description:
The white lines around this busy roundabout are now so faded they are difficult to see even in daylight. I did report this last year but you said inspection would take place but now nearly 10 months later nothing has been done and they have worsened. They need urgently repainting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
